questions.question_text:
Universal Containers sells a container management bundle with Product Options representing different service levels. The admin has created a Configuration Attribute for the bundle to let users specify the service level.

Which two actions should the admin take to limit the options in the bundle that are displayed to the user when a service level is selected? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Ensure Apply Immediately is set to TRUE on the Configuration Attribute.
choices.B: Ensure Apply to Product Options is set to TRUE on the Configuration Attribute.
choices.A: Create a Selection Product Rule that automatically shows and hides Product Options based on the service level.
choices.D: Create a Selection Price Rule that automatically shows and hides Product Options based on the service level.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
A and C are correct. Tested and verified. This has nothing to do with Price Rules, and "Apply to Product Options" is for pushing the same field (product option) selection from the parent bundle down to the child products, as linked below, which also has nothing to do with what's displayed to the user.
I think A and C are correct.

AC

B (Apply To Product Options) means that when you select the value for the bundle, it cascades down and is applied to the options. It's got nothing to do with showing/hiding/etc products

per https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.cpq_config_attribute_guidelines.htm&type=5:

Apply Immediately
Apply field value changes whenever a user changes the configuration attribute’s value. When deselected, Salesforce CPQ applies field changes when the user saves the bundle configuration.
Apply to Product Options
Apply the configuration attribute’s value to all matching fields in your bundle’s product options. When this field is not selected, Salesforce CPQ applies the value to only matching fields in the bundle parent.

comments.content: Option C is not relevant to this scenario, as it refers to whether the Configuration Attribute should be applied immediately or after the user saves the configuration.
